item.title: Can someone tell me what's wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

First of all, try to use code tags here on the forum. They work like this:
[code]
STUFF HERE
[/code]

Next, the problem your getting is because the arguments for the addItem() method that you provided, which was String, cannot be used with the addItem() method that is already there for you, which is (Int, Int). Simply remove the quotation marks (" ") around your numbers in the addItem() method that you called three times.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone tell me what's wrong with this code?

item.title: Can someone tell me what's wrong with this code?
item.dc:creator: @Renob Renob
item.description:
@Renob wrote:

Hi, I’m trying to make it so you can use an item on a rock and get a bunch of runes/arrows/food etc. here is the code I’m using:

                            else if(useItemID == 671 && atObjectID == 444) {
							deleteItem(671, getItemSlot(671), 1);
			addItem("4278, 2000");
			addItem("568, 4000");
			addItem("554, 6000");
							sendMessage("The rock is rejoiced with the return of it's baby and gives you Barrage Runes!");
							}

When I compile it, get this error:

client.java:16569: addItem(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.string)

I have 8 errors with the same thing except the “client.java:>>16570<<” the numbers in >><< changes to:

16569, 16570, 16571, 16576, 16577, 16578, 16583, 16588

If you need any other info just ask, and thanks from a noob

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone tell me what's wrong with this code?
